sub_topic: The self-similarity of the Sierpinski carpet.
message_1: What is the area of the Sierpinski carpet after the nth iteration if the initial carpet has a side length of 3 units? (Assuming that each smaller square in the iteration has a side length equal to one-third of the previous iteration)
message_2:
The area of the Sierpinski carpet after the nth iteration can be calculated using the formula:

Area = Initial Area * (1 - (1/9) * (8/9)^n)

where Initial Area is the area of the initial carpet with a side length of 3 units, which is 3^2 = 9 square units.

So, the area of the Sierpinski carpet after the nth iteration is:

Area = 9 * (1 - (1/9) * (8/9)^n)
